title: Network Address Translation (NAT)
subject: Computer Networks
theory:
Allows multiple devices (Private IPs) to share ONE Public IP. 
Router maintains a translation table (Private IP:Port <-> Public IP:Port).

examples.code:
PC (192.168.1.5) -> Router (8.8.8.8) -> Internet.
Internet sees request coming from 8.8.8.8.

interview_questions.question: Can server initiate connection behind NAT?
interview_questions.answer: No. Router drops unknown incoming packets. Needs Port Forwarding.
